query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.result:
**English:**
1 In new pain I must make verses 2 and give material to the twentieth canto 3 of the first song, which is of those submerged.
**Malay:**
1 Dalam kesakitan yang baru, aku harus membuat syair 2 dan memberikan materi untuk nyanyian kedua puluh 3 dari nyanyian pertama, yang tentang mereka yang tenggelam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.result:
**English:**
10 As my gaze descended lower, 11 I saw, to my astonishment, that each one 12 was twisted between the chin and the beginning of the chest,
13 for their faces had been turned around, 14 and they had to walk backward, 15 because they were unable to see in front of them.
**Malay:**
10 Ketika pandanganku turun lebih rendah, 11 dengan menakjubkan tampaklah bahwa masing-masing 12 terpelintir antara dagu dan pangkal dada,
13 karena wajah mereka telah diputarbalikkan, 14 dan mereka harus berjalan mundur, 15 karena mereka tidak dapat melihat ke depan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Perhaps by force of paralysis already 17 some of them were completely overthrown; 18 but I did not see it, nor do I believe it is so.
**Malay:**
16 Mungkin karena kekuatan kelumpuhan 17 beberapa dari mereka benar-benar terguling; 18 tetapi aku tidak melihatnya, dan aku tidak percaya itu benar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.result:
**English:**
19 If God lets you, reader, take fruit 20 from your lesson, now think for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
22 when I saw our image so twisted nearby, 23 that the tears from my eyes 24 wet my buttocks through the crack.
**Malay:**
19 Jika Tuhan membiarkanmu, pembaca, mengambil manfaat 20 dari pelajaranmu, sekarang pikirkan sendiri 21 bagaimana aku bisa menahan wajahku agar tidak basah,
22 ketika aku melihat bayangan kita begitu bengkok di dekatnya, 23 sehingga air mata dari mataku 24 membasahi pantatku melalui celah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Certainly I wept, leaning against one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my guide 27 said to me: "Are you still one of those fools?
28 Here lives pity when it is truly dead; 29 who is more wicked than he 30 who endures passion in the face of divine judgment?
31 Lift up your head, lift it up, and see to whom 32 the earth opened up before the eyes of the Thebans; 33 because of which they all cried out: "Where are you rushing,
34 Amphiaraus? Why do you leave the war?".
**Malay:**
25 Pastilah aku menangis, bersandar pada salah satu batu 26 dari tebing yang keras, sehingga pemanduku 27 berkata kepadaku: "Apakah kamu masih salah satu dari orang-orang bodoh itu?
28 Di sinilah hidup belas kasihan ketika benar-benar mati; 29 siapa yang lebih jahat daripada dia 30 yang menanggung nafsu di hadapan penghakiman ilahi?
31 Angkat kepalamu, angkat, dan lihat kepada siapa 32 bumi terbuka di hadapan mata orang-orang Thebes; 33 karena itu mereka semua berteriak: "Ke mana kamu bergegas,
34 Amphiaraus? Mengapa kamu meninggalkan perang?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.result:
**English:**
35 And it did not stop its ruin down into the valley 36 until Minos, who seizes each one.
37 See how he has made a chest of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 he looks behind and makes a backward path.
**Malay:**
35 Dan tidak berhenti meruntuhkan lembah 36 hingga Minos, yang menangkap setiap orang.
37 Lihatlah bagaimana dia telah membuat dada dari bahunya; 38 karena dia ingin melihat terlalu jauh ke depan, 39 dia melihat ke belakang dan membuat jalan mundur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Aronta is he who turns his back to their bellies, 47 who in the mountains of Luni, where quarries 48 the Carrarese who dwells below,
49 had among the white marbles his cave 50 for his dwelling; whence to gaze at the stars 51 and the sea his view was not cut off.
**Malay:**
46 Aronta adalah dia yang membelakangi perut mereka, 47 yang di pegunungan Luni, tempat menggali 48 orang Carrarese yang tinggal di bawah,
49 memiliki di antara marmer putih gua 50 untuk tempat tinggalnya; dari sana untuk memandang bintang-bintang 51 dan laut pandangannya tidak terhalang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
55 Manto fu, che cercò per terre molte; 56 poscia si puose là dove nacqu’ io; 57 onde un poco mi piace che m’ascolte.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And she who covers her breasts, 53 which you do not see, with her hair flowing loose, 54 and has every part of her skin hairy,
55 Was Manto, who searched through many lands; 56 then she settled down in the place where I was born; 57 therefore it pleases me a little that she listen to me.
**Malay:**
52 Dan dia yang menutupi payudaranya, 53 yang tidak kamu lihat, dengan rambutnya yang terurai, 54 dan seluruh kulitnya berbulu,
55 Adalah Manto, yang mencari-cari di banyak negeri; 56 kemudian dia menetap di tempat kelahiranku; 57 oleh karena itu aku senang dia mendengarkan aku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.result:
**English:**
58 After his father departed from life 59 and the city of Bacchus became a slave, 60 this [city] rejoiced for a long time throughout the world.
**Malay:**
58 Setelah ayahnya meninggal 59 dan kota Bacchus menjadi budak, 60 kota ini bersukacita untuk waktu yang lama di seluruh dunia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Germany, 63 above the Tyrol, which is called Benaco.
**Malay:**
61 Di atas di Italia yang cantik terletak sebuah tasik, 62 di kaki Pegunungan Alpen yang mengelilingi Jerman, 63 di atas Tyrol, yang bernama Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Through a thousand springs, I believe, and more it is fed 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennino 66 from the water that stagnates in the said lake.
**Malay:**
64 Melalui seribu mata air, saya percaya, dan lebih banyak lagi yang mengairi 65 antara Garda dan Val Camonica dan Pennino 66 dari air yang menggenang di danau tersebut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.result:
**English:**
67 There, where the Trentine shepherd, 68 and he of Brescia, and the Veronese 69 could sign their flocks, if they were there.
**Malay:**
67 Di sana, di mana gembala Trentino, 68 dan dia dari Brescia, dan Veronese 69 dapat menandakan kawanan mereka, jika mereka ada di sana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Peschiera sits, beautiful and strong fortress 71 to confront the Brescians and Bergamasques, 72 where the shore around descends more.
**Malay:**
70 Peschiera terletak, benteng yang indah dan kuat 71 untuk menghadapi orang-orang Brescia dan Bergamo, 72 di mana pantai di sekitarnya lebih menurun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.result:
**English:**
73 There it is necessary that everything fall 74 that cannot stay in Benaco's lap, 75 and it becomes a river down through green pastures.
**Malay:**
73 Di situlah segala sesuatu harus jatuh 74 yang tidak dapat tinggal di pangkuan Benaco, 75 dan menjadi sungai mengalir melalui padang rumput hijau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.result:
**English:**
76 As soon as the water begins to flow, 77 it is no longer called Benaco, but Mincio, 78 until Governolo, where it falls into the Po.
**Malay:**
76 Segera setelah air mulai mengalir, 77 ia tidak lagi disebut Benaco, tetapi Mincio, 78 hingga Governolo, tempat ia jatuh ke sungai Po.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.
query.result:
**English:**
79 He had not traveled far when he found a marsh, 80 in which he spread out and wallowed; 81 and in summer it would sometimes be dry.
**Malay:**
79 Dia belum berjalan jauh, ketika dia menemukan sebuah rawa, 80 di mana dia menyebar dan berkubang; 81 dan tanahnya terkadang kering di musim panas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then, passing by the raw virgin, 83 he saw land, in the middle of the marsh, 84 untilled and naked of inhabitants.
**Malay:**
82 Kemudian, melewati perawan yang kasar 83 ia melihat tanah, di tengah rawa, 84 tak bercocok tanam dan telanjang tanpa penghuni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.result:
**English:**
85 There, to flee from all human company, 86 he stopped with his servants to practice his arts, 87 and he lived there and left his empty body.
**Malay:**
85 Di sana, untuk melarikan diri dari semua pergaulan manusia, 86 ia berhenti bersama para pelayannya untuk mempraktikkan keseniannya, 87 dan ia hidup di sana dan meninggalkan tubuhnya yang hampa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Then the men who were scattered around 89 gathered at that place, which was strong 90 because of the marsh that surrounded it on all sides.
**Malay:**
88 Kemudian orang-orang yang bertebaran di sekitar 89 berkumpul di tempat itu, yang kuat 90 karena rawa yang mengelilinginya di semua sisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.
query.result:
**English:**
91 To make the city over those dead bones; 92 and because of her who first chose the place, 93 Mantua is its name without any other fate.
**Malay:**
91 Untuk membuat kota di atas tulang-belulang yang mati itu; 92 dan karena dia yang pertama kali memilih tempat itu, 93 Mantua adalah namanya tanpa nasib lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Already his people were outside, more thickly packed, 95 before the madness from Casalodi 96 received deception from Pinamonte.
**Malay:**
94 Orang-orangnya sudah berada di luar, lebih padat, 95 sebelum kegilaan dari Casalodi 96 menerima tipu daya dari Pinamonte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.result:
**English:**
97 But be assured that if you ever hear 98 the origin of my land otherwise, 99 the truth is devoid of any lie or deceit.
**Malay:**
97 Tetapi ketahuilah bahwa jika kamu pernah mendengar 98 asal usul tanah airku yang lain, 99 kebenarannya tidak mengandung dusta atau tipu daya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And I: "Master, your reasonings 101 are so certain and so take my faith, 102 that the others would be extinguished coals to me.
**Malay:**
100 Dan aku: "Guru, alasan-alasanmu 101 begitu meyakinkan dan begitu mengambil kepercayaanku, 102 sehingga yang lain akan menjadi bara api yang padam bagiku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».
query.result:
**English:**
103 But tell me, of the people who are proceeding, 104 if you see any worthy of note; 105 for my mind is set only on that».
**Malay:**
103 Tetapi katakan padaku, tentang orang-orang yang sedang berjalan, 104 jika kamu melihat seseorang yang patut dicatat; 105 karena pikiranku hanya tertuju pada itu».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Then he said to me: "He who gives the dew 107 to the beard on his brown shoulders, 108 was—when Greece was emptied of men,
109 so that hardly any remained for the cradles— 110 an augur, and gave the signal with Calchas 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.
**Malay:**
106 Kemudian dia berkata kepadaku: "Dia yang memberikan embun 107 kepada janggut di bahunya yang cokelat, 108 adalah—ketika Yunani kosong dari laki-laki,
109 sehingga hampir tidak ada yang tersisa untuk buaian— 110 seorang peramal, dan memberi tanda dengan Calchas 111 di Aulis untuk memotong tali pertama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 His name was Euryphilus, and thus 113 my lofty tragedy sings in some place: 114 you know it well, for you know it all.
**Malay:**
112 Namanya Euryphilus, dan demikian 113 tragedi agungku menyanyikannya di suatu tempat: 114 kamu tahu betul karena kamu tahu semuanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.result:
**English:**
115 That other one who is so lean in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 knew the game of magical deceptions.
**Malay:**
115 Yang lainnya yang sangat kurus di bagian pinggang, 116 adalah Michael Scot, yang sungguh-sungguh 117 mengetahui permainan tipu daya sihir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.result:
**English:**
118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who would not want to have heard of the leather and the twine, 120 but later repents.
**Malay:**
118 Lihat Guido Bonatti; lihat Asdente, 119 yang tidak ingin mendengar tentang kulit dan benang, 120 tetapi kemudian menyesal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.
query.result:
**English:**
121 See the sad women who abandoned the needle, 122 the spool and the spindle, and made themselves divine; 123 they worked magic with herbs and images.
**Malay:**
121 Lihatlah para wanita sedih yang meninggalkan jarum, 122 kumparan dan poros, dan menjadikan diri mereka suci; 123 mereka melakukan sihir dengan tumbuhan dan gambar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Thus she spoke to me, and we went on together.
**Malay:**
130 Demikianlah ia berbicara kepadaku, dan kami melanjutkan perjalanan bersama.
